reviewText: I was glad to have this on DVD. It has always been one of my favorite stories. A classic movie.
This is a great WWII movie that was very well produced. Monte Woolley was great as the lead. It arrived quicker than promised and was a very good copy.
Excellent movie. I would love to buy a DVD. Are there any out there? I will even buy a VHS.

Western Europe,1940. English nobleman,MR Howard(Monty Wooliey)is on vacation,but soon problems galore. The nazis invade. MR Howard has little use for children,but soon he gets stuck with several refuge children whos parents were victims of the invading Germans. Showing his true colors MR Howard feels its his duty and responsiblity to try to get them to England.
They have their share of adventures,but are soon picked up by the Germans. SS Major Diessan(Otto Preminger)makes a deal with MR Howard to let him continue his jorney to England,but theres a catch to it. What could it be?
Great Film.
Also in cast,Anne Baxter,Roddy McDowall,Helmut Dantine,Peggy Ann Garner,etc

an incredible film with action plot twists and drama and captures the turmoil of war with some comic relief,would have paid twice the price, Roddy was better known for "how green was my valley" but in my opinion was far better in this one
Saw it once on youtube. Haven't been able to find it to rent or buy since. It was a lovely story.  Warm, funny, and a lot of heart  I would love to see it again and have my granddaughter's to see it.

What a wonderful movie!! It reminds me history, unfortunately, keeps repeating itself. Maybe we can learn from watching films like this. The acting was wonderful. I had a terrible time finding a copy of this film.
Wanted the one with Peter O'Toole but couldn't find it.  That version came out as a TV movie in the 80's.  Love Monty Woolley though, so should be a treat.
Very pleased, bought previous from a different supplier and it was a very poor copy.  This one is exactly what my father was looking for.  Will use again.
Monty Wooley was far from the book protagonist, but this is not a criticism. Book was of course more intense, the journey far more difficult but all in all a fair version, if not a great one.

Delivery was a bit slow but worth the wait. Monty Wooley was a brilliant character actor. This is the story of a gruff English gentleman tourist who risks his life to smuggle Jewish children out of Nazi-occupied France. He eventually runs into a German General portrayed by famed director Otto Preminger ("Night of the Hunter") who makes an unexpected request.
I love this movie. It's a wonderful story of an older gentlemen trying to get children out of Europe and back to England at the start of World War II. Thankyou for finally making this available.

The Pied Piper (1942) with Monty Woolley, Roddy McDowell, Anne Baxter, and Otto Preminger is an exceptional WWII movie that the whole family can enjoy. It tells the story of an elderly man that takes a fishing trip to try and relive some of the good times with his son that has been killed. While in a small village in France, the Germans invade. He is asked to take two children back to England for safety. As they make their way by any means of transportation they can, the two becomes several children. One of my all time favorites. I enjoyed it so much on TV that I bought mine overseas to get this on DVD-R from a British library. To my knowledge no studio has purchased the rights and put it out on commercial DVD to date. I hope they do because it is a great movie and I think one of Monty Wooley's best. Recommendations: The Man Who Came to Dinner,Molly and Me CA Luster

The film itself is excellent.  However, I was not aware when I ordered it that it's a DVR rather than a commercially processed DVD.  The packaging is Spartan, and there are no extras on the disc.  However, the picture quality, while not professionally remastered to be a crisp image with excellent contrasts, is certainly much better than many from sources such as this.  If you want this film for your collection, this is the only option at the moment, and you could do a lot worse.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.
